intro: Pseudospigelia polystachya, commonly known as the Florida spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are simple and alternate. It has a milky sap that is characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Pseudospigelia polystachya plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
